tipassoi wrote:

>
> I have been trying all day, and cannot get heritrix to run. I have
> tried on both cygwin and windows NT command prompt (but would prefer
> to use the latter).
>
> In Windows, I saved heritrix inside a folder \project and added
> \project to the classfile. I set %HERITRIX_HOME% to the right place.
> But now I have no idea of how to get it to run (typing java heritrix
> throws Exception in thread "main" java.lang.noClassDefFoundError:
> heritrix)

There is no class 'heritrix'.  There is 'org.archive.crawler.Heritrix' 
so typing 'java org.archive.crawler.Heritrix' should get something 
running if your CLASSPATH is right (Make sure that the heritrix jar 
comes before all others).

>
> In Cygwin, I set %HERITRIX_HOME% and %JAVA_HOME% to the appropriate
> places, chmod'ed, then tried to run. It said Starting heritrix... then
> continued to print out dots for over an hour. Is it meant to take this
> long?

Look in heritrix_out.log and heritrix_dmesg.log if present.  These 
should tell you why its not starting.

>
>
> If anyone can help it would be really appreciated. Please note that I
> have very little computer knowledge (I only got my first computer 2
> months ago), so don't assume I know how to do anything. Explain as if
> to a very small child - I promise not to feel patronised!

Smile.

 (You have seen section '2.1.1.3. Linux' in the user manual? 
http://crawler.archive.org/articles/user_manual.html).

St.Ack
